required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-label Study to Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose of DSG3-CAART in Mucosal-dominant PV Patients (mPV)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-label, Safety and Dosing Study of Autologous Desmoglein 3 Chimeric Autoantibody Receptor T Cells (DSG3-CAART) in Subjects With Active, Anti-DSG3, Mucosal-dominant Pemphigus Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: Mucosal-dominant pemphigus vulgaris (mPV) is a B-cell mediated autoimmune disorder in which painful blisters are formed on the mucosal membrane, including the mouth, nose, throat, eyelids, anus, and genitals. This phase 1 study is being conducted to find the maximum tolerated dose and optimal fractionated infusion schedule of an investigational cell therapy, DSG3-CAART, that can be given to patients with mPV who are inadequately managed by standard therapies. DSG3-CAART may potentially lead to complete and durable remission of disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Adverse events, including Dose Limit Toxicity
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of the study is the incidence of adverse events that are related to DSG3-CAART therapy within 3 months of DSG3-CAART cell infusion.

secondary_outcome.description: Percent of total cells for infusion that are CAAR-transduced cells by flow cytometry
Total DSG3-CAART positive cells for each manufacturing run by flow cytometry
Cellular kinetics profile of DSG3-CAART assessed by quantitative polymerase chain reaction
Change in DSG3 autoantibody titer by ELISA compared to pre-infusion visit
Proportion of subjects achieving serologic remission, determined by negative DSG3 ELISA titer
Change in PDAI compared to pre-infusion visit, scored on a 0-250 scale where a greater number represents more disease activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical remission: complete remission off therapy and complete remission on minimal therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving complete remission, determined by a PDAI activity score of 0 for at least 2 months, either off therapy or on minimal therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to clinical remission and time to serologic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Time to clinical remission and time to serologic remission from the last infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of clinical remission and duration of serologic remission
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of clinical remission and duration of serologic remission sustained after achieving the initial remission

arm_group.description: Cohort A: Fractionated infusions of DSG3-CAART at increasing dose levels (4 groups) administered as a single cycle. Cohort B: Consolidation of infusion of DSG3-CAART to fewer fractionations than in Cohort A using the selected dose from Cohort A (2 groups) administered as a single cycle. Cohort C: Infusion of final selected dose and fractionation of DSG3-CAART from Cohorts A and B (1 group) administered as a single cycle

intervention.description: Intravenous infusions of DSG3-CAART at different doses and different fractionations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis of mPV by prior biopsy and prior positive DSG3 ELISA
- mPV inadequately managed by at least two standard immunosuppressive therapies
- Active mPV at screening
- DSG3 ELISA positive at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cutaneous lesions associated with PV
- Rituximab in last 6 months
- Prednisone > 0.25mg/kg/day
- Other autoimmune disorder requiring immunosuppressive therapies
- Investigational treatment in last 6 months
- Absolute lymphocyte count < 1,000/ÂµL at screening
